intro: Leucadendron cinaroides, commonly known as the silver coin bush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking silver-green leaves and spherical, yellow-orange flower heads. The plant is evergreen, with dense foliage that provides ornamental value in gardens. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for coastal and Mediterranean climates. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a valuable addition to native plant collections.
